prop print

Usage Synopsis
Print all properties $ appbuilder prop print [--valid-value] [--debug] [--release]
Print a selected property $ appbuilder prop print <Property Name> [--valid-value] [--debug] [--release]

Prints information about the configuration of the project or the selected property. If --valid-value is set, prints the valid configuration values. If not set, prints the current configuration.

Options

  • --valid-value - When set, prints the valid values for all valid project properties or for the selected property.

  • --debug - When set, prints information about your project settings for the Debug build configuration. This switch is applicable to the $ appbuilder prop print and $ appbuilder prop print CorePlugins commands. For more information about build configurations, see Managing Build Configurations.

  • --release - When set, prints information about your project settings for the Release build configuration. This switch is applicable to the $ appbuilder prop print and $ appbuilder prop print CorePlugins commands. For more information about build configurations, see Managing Build Configurations.

Attributes

  • <Property Name> is the name of the project property as listed by $ appbuilder prop print

Related Commands

Command Description
edit-configuration Opens a configuration file for editing.
mobileframework Lists all supported versions of the current development framework.
mobileframework set Sets the selected development framework version for the project.
prop Lets you manage the properties for your project.
prop add Enables more options for the selected project property, if the property accepts multiple values.
prop remove Disables options for the selected project property, if the property accepts multiple values.
prop set Sets the selected project property and overwrites its current value.
resource Lists information about the image resources for all mobile platforms.
resource create Creates image resources for all mobile platforms from a single high-resolution image.
webview Lists the available web views for iOS and Android.
webview set Sets the selected web view for the current project.
